meanings.definition: A small grocery store, especially in a Spanish-speaking neighborhood.
meanings.sent1: I went to the bodegas to buy some milk and bread.
meanings.sent2: The bodegas on the corner always has fresh produce.
meanings.sent3: Why did the tomato go to the bodegas? To catch up with the celery!
meanings.sent4: The bodegas stood like a colorful beacon in the bustling neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The bodegas with its bright sign was a welcoming sight after a long day.

meanings.sent1: The bodegas had a wide selection of fine wines from around the world.
meanings.sent2: We visited a charming bodegas in the countryside for a wine tasting.
meanings.sent3: Why did the grape feel at home in the bodegas? It was in its element!
meanings.sent4: The bodegas was a treasure trove of aged wines waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of wine filled the bodegas, enticing visitors to explore its offerings.

meanings.sent1: The company used the bodegas to store excess inventory during the busy season.
meanings.sent2: The bodegas were filled with crates and boxes waiting to be shipped.
meanings.sent3: Why did the box feel safe in the bodegas? It knew it was in good hands!
meanings.sent4: The bodegas loomed large, holding the secrets of countless items within.
meanings.sent5: The bodegas were a maze of shelves, each holding a different treasure.
